result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan J. Ortiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Graffiti, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.017(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If graffiti is repaired and restitution is paid, the Court would not oppose early termination of probation.

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $563.40 plus surcharges.
Repair graffiti damage.

records.addlTxt: NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Expunction hearing.  Court will reconsider deft for expunction after his current case is completed.
Terminated - Regular  kmk
Court orders the extension of probation cancelled; restitution was paid in full as of 3/27/17.  kmk

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  No appearance by the Defendant.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Issue of outstanding restitution and court costs.  ADA Phan requests an extension.  Court extends deft's probation for 1 year.
Probation review hearing on March 24, 2017 at 11:15 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Restitution determined in the amount of $563.40  kmk
for Restitution Order ($563.40)  kmk
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Henry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $200 DNA surcharge; restitution ordered in the amount of $563.40 (by stipulation of deft); if graffiti is repaired and restitution is paid the court would not oppose early termination of probation.  Expunction hearing set for 5/16/17 at 8:30am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
With Atty Henry and ADA Delgado the case is set for a PLEAS on 4/14/16 at 1:30pm; the JSH of 5/9/16 at 1:15pm and JS of 5/23/16 at 8:30am are removed from the calendar.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney O Uzowulu.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case is not resolved.  JSH 5/9/16 at 1:15pm and JS 5/23/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Henry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Henry states the deft received an offer from the State, deft wants to give a counter-proprosal, believes case will be resolved.  FPT continued to 3/4/16 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.  kmk
Aileen Henry  kmk
943.017(1) - Graffiti

157pm  Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Deft demands jury trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 02:40 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 08:15 am.  $1000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  kmk
